result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert T. Pavek

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert T. Pavek in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 9:15 am called in courtroom.  Court advises jurors case has settled.  Jurors excused by the court. re- called at 9:29 am.  Cases called 13CM196, 15CF109 and 16CF75.  16CF75 - Def to waive preliminary hearing.  Court reviews right to preliminary hearing with def.  Def waives preliminary.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause, bound over.  Information filed.  Information received and waive reading.  Plea agreement stated previously in chambers.  Plea advisement form completed and reviewed by court.  Ct 1 - OAR - No contest plea  Ct 3 - Felony Bail jumping - No contest plea.  Court will dismiss Ct 2 & 4.  Court will dismiss and read in 15CF109 and 13CM196 consistent with plea agreement.  Constitutional rights and right to jury trial reviewed.  Elements reviewed.  Courts finds def entered pleas freely & voluntarily.  Facts set forth by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Factual basis for pleas.  Pleas accepted, found guilty.  State presents sentencing arguments.  Sentencing arguments by Atty Abernethy-Mays.  Nothing by def.  Sentencing remarks by Court.  Court orders,  Ct 1 - sentence withheld, 1 yr probation   Alcohol & drug assessement and follow through.  Court cost plus DNA surcharge.  Pay cost of jury 13CM196, $612.47   Ct 3 Sentence withheld 2 yrs probation.  Cost plus DNA surcharge and DNA sample.  Credit of 3 days if revoked.  Felony conviction rights reviewed.  Court will apply $500.00 bond to court cost then apply $1000.00 to be applied and any balance to poster.  Bonds to be applied to jury cost also.  Post conviction rights.

13TR831, 13TR833 & 13TR749  @ 2:20 pm Defendant in person w/o counsel, Ralph Uttke appears for the State of Wisconsin- 13TR833 Refusal Hearing 1-27-16 @ 1:30,.13TR749 Speeding, OWI 13TR831 - 6-21-16 @ 9:00, No Final pretrial, Take traffic cases out of criminal file.  Defendant Robert T. Pavek in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF109 & 13CM196 @ 2:22 pm. 13CM196 J.T. 7-13-16, 9:00 #1, FPT 6-27-16 @ 3:30 pm.  If matter gets resolved, than will complete plea & sentencing on 7-13.  Def. must appear for final pretrial.  15CF109 Status Cnf. 6-27-16 @ 3:30 pm.  Court goes back on the record to clarify, 3 traffic cases, Speeding & OWI are not on same offense date.  Court will only hear 1 case on jury trial, because only 1 fee was paid.  Def. would like to have jury trial on OWI, So court will order J.T. on OWI, State moves to amend Speeding to 10 over. Def. makes statement, State will amend to 9 over, Court will grants amendment to 9 over, no contest plea, Finding Guilty & State is not amend fine & Court orders $250.90.  Def. given p.p.

Defendant Robert T. Pavek in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF109, 13CM196, 13TR831, 13TR833 @ 9:02 a.m. 15CF109 - preliminary hrg - Dep Greg Carter duly sworn on oath, testifies. Witness identifies Def. State moves for bind-over. Defense concedes to bind-over. Court finds probable cause and binds over Def. Information filed. Copy received, reading waived, reserve all motions, denies and enters not guilty pleas. Court accepts not guilty pleas. Def not required to attend status conf. However, Court recommends appearance and to stay in contact w/atty. All cases to follow.  Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
No possession or use of controlled substances without valid prescription

Defendant Robert T. Pavek in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF109 and 13CM196 and traffice citations in filed.  Special appearance by Atty Schuster.  On 13 file def had an atty., withdrawn.  Statement by Atty Schuster.  Response by State.  15CF109  Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Time limits for preliminary waived.  Response by State  Bond set by court for  this case.  13CM196 will follow  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
